p: The whole midgut was dissected from an adult insect using a pair of fine forceps under a binocular microscope in a plastic petri dish filled with phosphate-buffered saline (PBS; 137 mM NaCl, 8.1 mM Na 2HPO 4, 2.7 mM KCl, 1.5 mM KH 2PO 4 [pH 7.5]) and photographed by the use of a digital camera (EC3; Leica, Wetzlar, Germany) connected to a dissection microscope (S8APO; Leica, Wetzlar, Germany). The crypt-bearing midgut region ( Fig. 1B) was collected from the whole midgut and homogenized in PBS. The suspension of crypt contents was stained with 4 µM 4′,6-diamidino-2-phenylindole (DAPI) (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA) and observed under an epifluorescence microscope (DMI 4000 B; Leica, Wetzlar, Germany).
